a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Based on the expert assessments and index by the Economist Intelligence Unit (2023), weighted by countries'
populations. It combines information on the extent to which citizens can choose their political leaders in free and
fair elections, enjoy civil liberties, prefer democracy over other political systems, can and do participate in politics,
and have a functioning government that acts on their behalf. It ranges from 0 to 10 (most democratic).
Data source: Economist Intelligence Unit (2023), Economist Intelligence Unit (2021) via gapminder and other sources
